message: http://sxsw-preview-api.lanyrd.net/
oh this is realtime - hi.
due date - 2 days :-)

I'll have a go and see if I can get it into my app - it's a dumb idea. Before you go to an event make a note of the people that you'd like to bump into on a mobile app, then use it to find them using their photos.
(and generally keep out of the way...)
That's not dumb :-) If it could remind me of people's names as well...
do the speakers have profiles?
hello :)
it's pretty much a preview of what the full Lanyrd API will look like
wow, due that soon?
so the Lanyrd API returns Twitter avatars, which may or may not be useful
I'm actually just finishing up a mini-hack to help crowdsource associating Twitter handles with people who we know are speaking at the conference
right now we have 1400 speakers and only 3 of them have Twitter handles associated
http://sxsw-preview-api.lanyrd.net/crowdsource/2011/sxsw/
thought about using Yahoo BOSS?
No, thank you :-)
Rather excited - didn't know this was coming, and I have half an app just waiting for that API to be released.
yes, convore's a pretty handy tool - I think it'll be ideal for remote hacking
tell me if there's anything missing from it that you need
yup, just deploying the crowdsourcing tool
we'd been talking about it for a while, but today I took the time to actually build it
very exciting :)
yeah - it does that, and it also keeps a note of where you met people if you tap the 'met' button. And then it can save a contact into the addressbook with that info...
happy to help out with adding handles. Maybe a page that gives you a biog and a photo and a box beneath that says "what's their twitter username?" and a big next button.
and it looks exactly as I'd hoped it would...
definitely - I'm remote too. Waiting for a baby to hopefully arrive... so doing man things like, umm... coding?
Eg. http://developer.yahoo.com/yql/console/#h=select%20title%2Cabstract%20from%20search.web%20where%20query%3D%22Gunnar%20Holmsteinn%20is%20on%20twitter%22
ooh, that's a neat idea

that's the big problem - I've been building a scraper that tries to do some of that for you by following web addresses and trying to build up a profile of a person. Disambiguation is the big problem. "John Smith" * 1000
ah. way ahead of me
For anything in particular?
Or better select url from search.web where query="Gunnar Holmsteinn is on twitter"
Morning Simon *waves*
'morning (it's 2am here)
Love the crowdsourcing site btw (it's 5am here)
OK, just deployed the fix
Simon? I'm not very experienced with JSONP, but I note that the lanyrd api is preserving the last request's jsonp callback value in pagination.api_urls.next
I'll fix that now, thanks
hmmm... interesting, that's probably a bug

Spoke too soon :-( I may be missing something but: I get my data from http://http://sxsw-preview-api.lanyrd.net while pagination.api_urls.next sends me to http://sxsw-api-preview.lanyrd.net - which is a non-place
OK, that should be fixed now - really sorry about that, can't believe it slipped through
It's nice to be useful. I'm only diddling about really. I've got 'till my girl walks in to build something...
http://sxsw-preview-api.lanyrd.net/2011/sxsw/sessions/
Good from here. The rest of the bugs are all mine...
could you paste in an example URL?
the API URL that's giving the problem?
oops! definitely an error
fixing ...
right, I'm going to get a few hours sleep - I'll be around for API questions / feature requests / etc in a few hours
Just about to explore a lanyard API-> event programme ontology conversion  http://programme.ecs.soton.ac.uk/
Hey Tim! I'm in Norfolk but also lurking here. Shout if I can be of use...
@timdavies only the sessions for sxsw are available btw
OK. Tiny thing made - http://projects.neontribe.co.uk/gsxsw/
that's very cool :) I saw isotope the other day and thought it might be an interesting fit for schedule stuff
quick feature request: it should credit Simon Willison and Natalie Downe for Lanyrd
it's a joint project
Ooops, on it...
Fixed.
thanks :)
it'll stay up permanently, but will probably have the individual endponits redirected to the full API when that gets released
have you seen http://sxsw-preview-api.lanyrd.net/crowdsource/2011/sxsw/ ?
pulled in a bunch of favours :)
there's 1400 of them so it's been taking a while
would have to build tools to get people to confirm each other's work etc
Mechanical Turk?
so best to use an HTTP client that follows redirects
Impressive progress
I've got a scraped version of the schedule but adding in twitter usernames from lanyrd
Would be handy
Blimey
we're crowdsourcing our way through adding ALL of the presenter twitter names at the moment
we really don't like incorrect associations
Will this api preview stay up until sxsw?
yes, definitely
Thanks,
it takes 30-60 seconds per person
since we don't want to get anything wrong
so one person would take about 12 hours :/
nah, don't trust them to do a good enough job
easier to just get friends to do it
I've got a mo
it's 9am here
@simonw got a mo or is it ultra-late there now?

Anyway I just wanted to say thanks for exposing the API. I got reasonably far... I've done a demo of what I'm looking to do here http://metcha.heroku.com - it's a bit of scraping and API mixed together. Basically couldn't do everything I wanted to do with the API and just wanted to finish something!
Ah. That's what that sound is!
But it's a long way off finished!
let us know if there's anything we can add to the API
The lanyrd sxsw session listings. Are they likely to remain accurate? I'm pondering if I should switch from scrapping the sxsw page to using the lanyrd api
